attributes.Title: Sem-Jr Year Writ Prg
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Japanese
391G
UMass Amherst
This course is geared toward the development of the student?s skill in writing proper English prose. The student is expected to do a lot of writing during the semester.
Prerequisite: ENGLWRIT 112 or 113 or equivalent.
CW Gen Ed
Varies from 1 to 3 credits
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
32539

attributes.Title: Problems in Anthropology I
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Anthropology
364
UMass Amherst
Introduction to major issues in anthropological theory. Focus on key concepts in the discipline, important authors, and development of and debates over theoretical issues. Required for and limited to anthropology majors; satisfies the Junior Year Writing requirement for anthropology majors.
Open to Senior and Junior Anthropology majors only. Pre Req: ENGLWRIT 111/112/113
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
33131

attributes.Title: Intro Electrical & Comp Engin
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Engineering
112
UMass Amherst
Students select one of the four introductory engineering courses (ENGIN 110, 111, 112, or 113).  Within a small class, student teams explore real engineering designs.  This introduction to engineering design and/or manufacturing emphasizes development of communication skills (written, oral, and graphical).  Project required.  
Corequisites:  Simultaneous enrollment in MATH 131, or higher; enrollment in, or eligibility to enroll in ENGLWRIT 112.
Open to ENGIN, EE and CS ENG majors.
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
35940
Requisite: Corequisites:  Simultaneous enrollment in MATH 131, or higher; enrollment in, or eligibility to enroll in ENGLWRIT 112.

attributes.Title: Sem-Jr Year Writ Prg
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Chinese
391G
UMass Amherst
Required of all Chinese majors during their junior or senior year. Prerequisite: ENGLWRIT 112 or 113 or equivalent.
CW Gen Ed  You must have fulfilled your CW Gen Ed. requirement
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
61643
Requisite: Required of all Chinese majors during their junior or senior year. Prerequisite: ENGLWRIT 112 or 113 or equivalent.

attributes.Title: Writing in Microbiology
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Microbiology
360
UMass Amherst
Satisfies the Junior Year Writing requirement. Students develop their writing skills while completing a series of short assignments. Each participant will identify a biological topic of their choice to research and write about during the semester. Prerequisites: ENGLWRIT 112 and MICROBIO 310.
Microbio majors only
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
64640
Requisite: Satisfies the Junior Year Writing requirement. Students develop their writing skills while completing a series of short assignments. Each participant will identify a biological topic of their choice to research and write about during the semester. Prerequisites: ENGLWRIT 112 and MICROBIO 310.

attributes.Title: Writing About Astronomy
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Astronomy
301
UMass Amherst
Satisfies Junior Year Writing Requirement.  The goal of this course is
to teach the writing techniques and styles that are appropriate for
the types of careers that might be pursued by an astronomy major.  The
course will be composed of both a set of short writing assignments and
longer assignments, and some of these assignments will be orally
presented to the class.  All students will critique the talks, and
some written assignments will be exchanged between students for peer
editing and feedback.  Some papers will require analysis of
astrophysical data.  Prerequisites:  Completion of 200-level or higher astronomy class, ENGLWRIT 112 or 113, and at least the first two semesters of the first
year physics sequence.
Open to Senior and Junior Astronomy majors and minors only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
63768
Requisite: astrophysical data.  Prerequisites:  Completion of 200-level or higher astronomy class, ENGLWRIT 112 or 113, and at least the first two semesters of the first

attributes.Title: Social Issues in Computing
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Computer Science
305
UMass Amherst
Satisfies the Junior Year Writing requirement. The impact of computers on modern society. Prerequisites: CMPSCI major; ENGLWRIT 112 or equivalent.
Open to Senior and Junior Computer Science majors only. Pre Req: ENGLWRIT 112w/C  SATISFIES JUNIOR YEAR WRITING REQUIREMENT.  STUDENTS NEEDING SPECIAL PERMISSION MUST REQUEST OVERRIDES VIA THE ON-LINE FORM:  https://www.cs.umass.edu/overrides.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
13811
Requisite: Satisfies the Junior Year Writing requirement. The impact of computers on modern society. Prerequisites: CMPSCI major; ENGLWRIT 112 or equivalent.

attributes.Title: Writing In Physics
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physics
381
UMass Amherst
Satisfies Junior Year Writing requirement. Practice in different styles of science writing, leading to several long essays. Peer reviews, student presentations. Prerequisites: ENGLWRIT 112 or 113 and PHYSICS 284, or equivalent.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
61342
Requisite: Satisfies Junior Year Writing requirement. Practice in different styles of science writing, leading to several long essays. Peer reviews, student presentations. Prerequisites: ENGLWRIT 112 or 113 and PHYSICS 284, or equivalent.

attributes.Title: Tutoring Writing: Thry & Prac
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
English
329H
UMass Amherst
The study of writing, teaching of writing, and collaboration.  Intended for tutors in the Writing Center who develop a tutoring philosophy based on writing theories and research.  Mid-way through the semester, students tutor two hours per week.
Prerequisites: ENGLWRIT 112 or 113
Pre Req: ENGLWRIT 112or113 w/B  Students interested in the course should 
submit an application to writingcenter@acad.umass.edu by April 10:
(1) A formal letter explaining why the student is interested in and 
has potential to become a writing tutor;
(2) an academic writing sample (attached as a word or pdf file) and 
(3) the name and email address of the student's ENGLWRIT 112 
instructor or another instructor who can speak to the student's 
qualifications . Applications received after April 10th and before May 
applications will be invited to an interview and can expect a decision by finals week.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
38611

attributes.Title: Basic Writing
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
English Writing Program
111
UMass Amherst
ENGLWRIT 111 (Basic Writing) is a college-level intensive reading and writing course designed to prepare students for ENGLWRIT 112. The course fulfills the General Education U.S. Diversity (U) requirement and focuses on the theme of cultural borders.  Students produce essays incorporating course readings as well as their own personal experience and knowledge.  All classes are held workshop-style in computer classrooms to allow for writing, collaboration, and consultation among students and between students and teacher. (Gen.Ed. U)
Open to Sophomores & Freshmen only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
61707

attributes.Title: Writing in Engineering
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Engineering
351H
UMass Amherst
Description not available at this time
Pre Req: JR ENGIN majors in COMCOL Pre Req: ENGLWRIT 112  or CW
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65901

attributes.Title: CNS Junior Writing
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Natural Sciences
397A
UMass Amherst
Multidisciplinary professional writing course.  Research, analyze, reference and write in the formal and informal text conventions used by Environmental Sciences, Natural Resources Conservation, & Veterinary and Animal Sciences.
Open to Sr and Jr Animal Sci, BCT, BMATWT, Earth Systems, ENVIRSCI, Forestry, Geology, Natural Resource Studies, NRC, PLSOILIN, Pre-Vet, Sustainable Food & Farming, Sustainable Horticulture, Turfgrass Science & Management, WF&CON, and Science majors only Englwrit 112/113  or Engl 120
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
64647

attributes.Title: Writing In Comdis
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Communication Disorders
330
UMass Amherst
Practical writing in the fields of audiology and speech-language pathology, including diagnostic report and research paper formats. Emphasis on revision and peer editing. Satisfies Junior Year Writing requirement.
Pre Req: ENGLWRIT 112
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
61397

attributes.Title: Writing in Engineering
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Engineering
351
UMass Amherst
This course fulfills the University's Junior Year Writing Requirement for students in the College of Engineering. Students will be introduced to traditional technical and scientific writing forms, including outlines, summaries, mechanical and technical descriptions, extended technical definitions, research reports, and proposals. Grammar review, oral presentations and on-line research are significant components of this course. Students will also investigate ethics in engineering practice and research.
Open to Seniors & Juniors in the College of Engineering only. Pre Req: ENGLWRIT 112  or CW
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65889

attributes.Title: Writing for Sustainability
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Stockbridge Sch of Agriculture
382
UMass Amherst
Satisfies the Junior Year Writing requirement for PLSOILIN majors concentrating in Sustainable Agriculture and related fields.  Practice and improve writing while clarifying career goals and improving professional communication skills.  Prerequisite: ENGLWRIT 112 (or equivalent) and PLSOILIN 265.
Open to Sustainable Food and Farming majors only. ENGLWRIT 112orCW&PLSOILIN265  The course fufills the Junior Year Writing requirement for students in the Sustainable Food & Farming concentration.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65136
Requisite: Satisfies the Junior Year Writing requirement for PLSOILIN majors concentrating in Sustainable Agriculture and related fields.  Practice and improve writing while clarifying career goals and improving professional communication skills.  Prerequisite: ENGLWRIT 112 (or equivalent) and PLSOILIN 265.

attributes.Title: College Writing
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
English Writing Program
112
UMass Amherst
ENGLWRIT 112 (College Writing) is a first-year college-level writing course designed to help students expand their ability to write essays for academic, civic, and personal purposes and to develop their rhetorical awareness to write effectively in new social contexts. Based on the assumption that writing is a social activity, this course requires active engagement in the writing process, including pre-writing, peer review, revision, and editing. Students write five essays. This is the only course at UMass Amherst which satisfies the General Education College Writing (CW) requirement. Prerequisite: Placement into ENGLWRIT 112 through the Writing Placement Exam or a passing grade in ENGLWRIT 111 Basic Writing. May not be taken Pass/Fail.  (Gen.Ed. CW)
Prerequisite: ENGLWRIT 111 (or adequate performance on Writing Program placement test). Pre Req: ENGLWRIT 111
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
61710
Requisite: ENGLWRIT 112 (College Writing) is a first-year college-level writing course designed to help students expand their ability to write essays for academic, civic, and personal purposes and to develop their rhetorical awareness to write effectively in new social contexts. Based on the assumption that writing is a social activity, this course requires active engagement in the writing process, including pre-writing, peer review, revision, and editing. Students write five essays. This is the only course at UMass Amherst which satisfies the General Education College Writing (CW) requirement. Prerequisite: Placement into ENGLWRIT 112 through the Writing Placement Exam or a passing grade in ENGLWRIT 111 Basic Writing. May not be taken Pass/Fail.  (Gen.Ed. CW)
Prerequisite: ENGLWRIT 111 (or adequate performance on Writing Program placement test). Pre Req: ENGLWRIT 111

attributes.Title: Marketing Communication
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Isenberg School of Management
315
UMass Amherst
Learn to write print and on-line marketing materials.  Includes community service learning and sales presentations.  Intended for Marketing majors; open to all SOM majors.
Prerequisites: ENGLWRIT 112 or 113
Senior and Junior MARKETNG majors only. Pre Req: ENGLWRIT112,113 or CW  This course is best for Marketing majors.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65436

attributes.Title: Sem-Junior Writing
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Food Science
391C
UMass Amherst
Writing of various types of reports dealing with scientific and technical information. Includes at least one oral presentation dealing with some aspect of food science. Selected exercises peer-reviewed before submission. Prerequisite: completion of freshman writing requirement.
Food Science majors only Pre Req: ENGLWRIT 112 or CW
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
36959
Requisite: Writing of various types of reports dealing with scientific and technical information. Includes at least one oral presentation dealing with some aspect of food science. Selected exercises peer-reviewed before submission. Prerequisite: completion of freshman writing requirement.

attributes.Title: Intensive Literary Studies/Maj
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
English
200
UMass Amherst
Introduction to literary study, concentrating on close reading and analysis of texts, writing and revising critical essays, and discussion of the issues that underlie the study of literature. Prerequisite: ENGLWRIT 112 or equivalent.  This course is open to Pre-English (PR-ENGL) majors only
Open to English majors only. CW Gen Ed  Students need to have signed into the major before taking this class.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

Prerequisite: ENGLWRIT 112 or equivalent.  This course is open to Pre-English (PR-ENGL) majors only

attributes.Title: Newswriting and Reporting
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Journalism
300
UMass Amherst
This course covers the basic requirements of newswriting and reporting, including interviewing, covering news events, and more. This class will include in-class and outside reporting assignments, and fulfills Junior Year Writing requirement.
Open to Senior, Junior and Sophomore Journalism majors only. Pre Req: ENGLWRIT 112  Required for Major. 
Fulfills Junior Year Writing requirement.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
62873

attributes.Description:

2016
Kinesiology
355
UMass Amherst
Satisfies Junior Year Writing requirement. A variety of writing skills emphasized with assignments ranging from resumes to scientific writing (formerly Exercise Science).  Prerequisite: ENGLWRIT 112.
Open to Senior and Junior Kinesiology majors only.
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66364
Requisite: Satisfies Junior Year Writing requirement. A variety of writing skills emphasized with assignments ranging from resumes to scientific writing (formerly Exercise Science).  Prerequisite: ENGLWRIT 112.
